title: WCAS CHEM 201-0-01 Chemistry of Nature and Culture

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Chemistry 201 presents some basic concepts of chemistry in the context of topics of current interest. The fundamentals of inorganic and organic chemistry are introduced as information necessary for understanding how chemicals impact our world. Naturally occurring chemicals from the earth, the atmosphere, and the sea will be discussed, and as will aspects of the chemistry of radioactive materials, topics related to air and water quality, and the impact of chemical systems important in our everyday lives.

This course is directed to students with a minimal technical background; students who have earned credit in a college-level chemistry course will need to discuss eligibility with the instructor.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Chemistry for Changing Times by J.W. Hill and T.W. McCreary, Pearson, 2016

subject: CHEM
